intro: Anthemis clavata, commonly known as the clustered tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Anthemis clavata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties.
